title: The Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit-sharing
description: Genetic resources from plants, animals, fungi and other microorganisms are valuable for society, individuals and companies. This is the reason why there is need for regulation of access to utilising genetic resources.
cleaned_text: If you are a user or plan to access genetic resources or traditional knowledge associated with the genetic resources from other countries for research and development you must identify your obligations. When collecting or accessing genetic resources from a collection, you also must ensure to comply with the ABS obligations. The Danish EPA conducts checks with users of genetic resources for compliance with the EU ABS regulation. In Denmark, the Danish EPA is the competent authority for the administration of the EU ABS regulations. According to the executive order Bekendtgørelse om ansvarlig myndighed genetiske ressourcer it conducts user checks in order to ensure compliance with the EU ABS regulation in Denmark.
